noun.description: A medicine made by dissolving a drug in alcohol.
examples: the remedies can be administered in the form of tinctures
a bottle containing tincture of iodine
she could not keep a tincture of bitterness out of her voice

noun.description: Any of the conventional colors (including the metals and stains, and often the furs) used in coats of arms.

verb.description: Be tinged, flavored, or imbued with a slight amount of.
examples: Arthur's affability was tinctured with faint sarcasm

origin: Late Middle English (denoting a dye or pigment): from Latin tinctura dyeing, from tingere to dye or color. tincture (sense 2 of the noun) (early 17th century) comes from the obsolete sense imparted quality, likened to a tint imparted by a dye.
